meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>loose</kanji>, so the verb version is <vocabulary>to loosen</vocabulary>. This is when something loosens on its own, and not via your actions. You know this because a cow is loosening things, <reading>moo</reading> (む)...
readingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the one you learned with the kanji!
